positive_results.mechanism: PDE5 inhibition → cGMP elevation → vasodilation; shared VEGF/NO pathway genes
AMPK activation → glucose uptake; primary indication
positive_results.notes: Primary indication. Used as positive control.

positive_results.mechanism: Insulin sensitisation; shared INSR/AMPK pathway genes
Anti-angiogenic; TNF-alpha suppression; shared VEGF/IKZF pathway
BCR-ABL1 kinase inhibition; primary indication
KIT/PDGFRA inhibition; shared kinase pathway with CML
Aromatase (CYP19A1) inhibition → estrogen reduction
PARP1/2 inhibition → synthetic lethality in BRCA1/2-mutant cells
PD-1 checkpoint blockade; shared PDCD1/CD274 pathway
PD-1 checkpoint blockade; shared PDCD1/CD274/TMB pathway
COX-2/PTGS2 inhibition → prostaglandin reduction → anti-proliferative
CD20+ B-cell depletion; shared inflammatory pathway genes
TLR9 inhibition, autophagy modulation; shared interferonopathy pathway
CACNA2D1 subunit inhibition → reduced calcium influx
5-alpha-reductase inhibition; shared SRD5A1/SRD5A2 pathway
Microtubule polymerisation inhibition; primary indication
NLRP3 inflammasome inhibition; shared IL1B pathway genes
IKZF1/IKZF3 degradation via CRBN; immunomodulatory
Beta-adrenergic blockade → anti-angiogenic; VEGF pathway shared
positive_results.notes: Known FN pattern: drug_not_found in standard scoring.

positive_results.mechanism: mTOR pathway inhibition; TSC1/TSC2 direct targets
C5 complement inhibition; shared complement pathway genes
CFTR potentiation; direct CFTR shared gene
Antisense oligonucleotide promoting SMN2 exon 7 inclusion
positive_results.notes: KNOWN LIMITATION: max_phase=3, not in ChEMBL approved pool. drug_not_found expected. Case documents ASO coverage gap.

positive_results.mechanism: NPC1L1 inhibition → reduced cholesterol absorption
SGLT2 inhibition → diuresis, cardiac preload reduction

negative_results.mechanism: No known mechanistic link. MS is autoimmune/neurological; insulin targets INSR in metabolic context.
Anticoagulant targeting VKORC1/CYP2C9; no PD neurodegeneration link.
PPI (H+/K+ ATPase inhibitor); no dopamine/glutamate overlap.
HMGCR inhibitor in cholesterol metabolism; hemophilia A is monogenic F8 deficiency — no pathway overlap.
ACE inhibitor; no known eating disorder pathway connection.
Thyroid hormone replacement. No IBD mechanistic link.
Beta-lactam antibiotic. HCM is a genetic sarcomere disorder.
AChE inhibitor; ALS is TDP-43/SOD1 motor neuron degeneration, not cholinergic deficit. Tests cross-disease neurological over-generalisation.
Azole antifungal (CYP51 inhibitor). No neurodegeneration pathway overlap.
negative_results.notes: Tests antifungal vs neurological disease specificity.

negative_results.mechanism: Fluoroquinolone antibiotic (DNA gyrase inhibitor). No IKZF/CRBN/VEGF pathway overlap.
Antiprotozoal/antibiotic. No dopamine/alpha-synuclein pathway overlap.
Macrolide antibiotic. No ESR1/ERBB2/BRCA pathway overlap.
Sulfonylurea (KATP channel closer). No TNF/IL6/B-cell pathway overlap.
DPP-4 inhibitor for T2DM. No CACNA2D/ion channel pathway overlap.
SGLT2 inhibitor for T2DM. No BRCA/PARP/homologous recombination overlap.
PPAR-gamma agonist for T2DM. No dopamine/glutamate receptor pathway overlap.
Dihydropyridine calcium channel blocker. No CRBN/IKZF/myeloma pathway overlap.
Cardiac glycoside (Na+/K+ ATPase inhibitor). No CFTR channel overlap.
P2Y12 antiplatelet agent. No amyloid/tau/cholinergic pathway overlap.
Loop diuretic (NKCC2 inhibitor). No TNF/IL6/B-cell pathway overlap.
SSRI (SLC6A4 inhibitor). No CACNA2D/SCN1A ion channel overlap.
negative_results.notes: Tests SSRI vs epilepsy gene panel specificity.

negative_results.mechanism: Mood stabiliser (GSK3B inhibitor). No CFTR channel overlap.
GABA-A receptor positive modulator (sedative-hypnotic). No IBD pathway overlap.
Partial D2/D3 agonist antipsychotic. No AMPK/INSR/glucose metabolism overlap. Note: atypicals can cause metabolic side effects but this is not a therapeutic repurposing indication.
Calcineurin inhibitor (FKBP12/calcineurin). No BCR-ABL pathway overlap.
Xanthine oxidase inhibitor for gout. No demyelination/MS pathway overlap.
Topoisomerase II inhibitor (chemotherapy). No alpha-synuclein/LRRK2 overlap. Tests that cytotoxic chemotherapy does not score for neurodegeneration.
Calcineurin inhibitor (immunosuppressant). No tubulin/NLRP3/urate pathway overlap. Note: cyclosporine can CAUSE hyperuricemia but is not a gout treatment.
negative_results.notes: Tests that a drug causing a disease symptom is not scored as a treatment.

negative_results.mechanism: Anticoagulant (antithrombin III activator). No ESR1/ERBB2/BRCA overlap.
Leukotriene receptor antagonist for asthma. No AMPK/INSR/glucose metabolism overlap.

out_of_scope_cases.reason: CRS is a syndrome without a stable EFO ontology entry. OpenTargets returns non-deterministic gene sets across API versions. Excluded in v3 for reproducibility.
